memberdef.name: lora_send_async

simplesect.para: This returns immediately after starting transmission, and locks the LoRa modem until the transmission completes.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the data to be sent
A pointer to a valid and ready to be signaled struct k_poll_signal. (Note: if NULL this function will not notify the end of the transmission).

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint8_t *data, uint8_t size, k_timeout_t timeout, int16_t *rssi, int8_t *snr)
memberdef.name: lora_recv

parameterdescription.para: Size of the buffer to hold the received data. Max size allowed is 255.
Duration to wait for a packet.

simplesect.para: Length of the data received on success, negative on error

detaileddescription.para: Receive packets continuously under the configuration previously setup by lora_config.
Reception is cancelled by calling this function again with cb = NULL. This can be done within the callback handler.

parameterdescription.para: Callback to run on receiving data. If NULL, any pending asynchronous receptions will be cancelled.

simplesect.para: 0 when reception successfully setup, negative on error

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint32_t frequency, int8_t tx_power, uint16_t duration)
memberdef.name: lora_test_cw

briefdescription.para: Transmit an unmodulated continuous wave at a given frequency.

simplesect.para: Only use this functionality in a test setup where the transmission does not interfere with other devices.
